channel.title: Xbox Live Softmod old maps?
channel.description: Well, a while ago i softmodded my xbox for halo 2 and it went perfectly, but i turned them off after a while because i missed matchmaking. Now that i am going to get an xbox 360, I wanna re-mod my old xbox, but this time mod old maps also since they are a million times better. I know a lot about moddng so no need to explain out the basic deatails. Links to working tutorials would be great also.

item.title: Xbox Live Softmod old maps?
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

Oh yeah you can do that swap trick and it is the only one that will work on live. There is the link for the tut on the page on that video

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox Live Softmod old maps?
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

i dont really have a problem opening up my xbox to hotswap, but i don’t see why i need to open up my computer also? Can you tell me why i have to open up my computor?

And also, what about doing this so i don’t need to open up my xbox?

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox Live Softmod old maps?
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

If you don’t want to hotswap (you have to open both comp ad xbox) then you’ll have to get a modchip…

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox Live Softmod old maps?
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

The things im trying to avoid by doing this mostly
1.) Taking apart my computer (no way im doing this)
2.) Completely taking apart my xbox (ill undo some screws but hopefully nothing more than that)
3.) something that costs a lot of money (duh heh)

Im hoping there is a way to mod old maps on live without doing any of the following, so if you know any information i don’t know, please post it.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox Live Softmod old maps?
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

@teh spede, yes that would work, but i want to play old maps modded on xbox live and that method will not allow you to sign on to xbox live.

@The Un-Named, im doing it on my old xbox since now i wont need it since i will be getting a 360 lol

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox Live Softmod old maps?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Using mods on your 360 disables your XBox Live account. :\

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox Live Softmod old maps?
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

Umm download halo 2 and ftp it to your hdd of the xbox (if it is softmodded) and then it should be easy to replace the maps by overwriting them

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox Live Softmod old maps?
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

I found some tutorials there on modding old maps (they are all basically the same), but they all involded completely taking apart my xbox, taking apart my computer, loads of programs to install, and way more.

If thats the only way to do it, i guess ill only mod the old maps because i dont want to take apart my computer and ide only take apart my xbox if its a couple screws, nothing more =\

But im pretty sure there is an easier way to do it because i know a couple people who mod old maps on xbox live and im pretty sure they didnt need to do all of that.

Thanks for that link though, but im still looking for links if there are ones out there.

Read full topic
